TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit MemberDescriptor extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a class member, such as a property or event. This is an abstract base class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor> is the base class for the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor> and the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> classes. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor> class provides a description of an event, and the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> class provides a description of a property.
This class defines properties and methods to access its stored attributes. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.Attributes%2A> property gets the collection of attributes. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.Category%2A>, <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.IsBrowsable%2A>, <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.Description%2A>, and <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.DesignTimeOnly%2A> properties retrieve the values of those specific attributes. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.Name%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.DisplayName%2A> properties provide the name of the member.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor> also defines an <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.Equals%2A> method to compare this <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor> to another.
> [!NOTE] > Typically, you inherit from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> classes, and not from this class.
## Examples Since most of the usage of this class will fall on the inherited classes <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>, refer to the examples in these classes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an array of attributes.
Docs.value: An array of type that contains the attributes of this member.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Accessing this member allows derived classes to modify the default set of attributes that are used in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.CreateAttributeCollection%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of attributes for this member.
Docs.value: An that provides the attributes for this member, or an empty collection if there are no attributes in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If there is no <xref:System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection> for this member, this property calls the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.CreateAttributeCollection%2A> method to create a new <xref:System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection> using the array of <xref:System.Attribute> objects passed to the constructor.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A visual designer can use this property value to display members in categories.

Docs.summary: Creates a collection of attributes using the array of attributes passed to the constructor.
Docs.returns: A new that contains the attributes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.Attributes%2A> property when there is no <xref:System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection> for this member. If there are no attributes in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.AttributeArray%2A>, this will return an empty <xref:System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection>.

Docs.param: An that lists the attributes in the parent class. Initially, this is empty.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, adds the attributes of the inheriting class to the specified list of attributes in the parent class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For duplicate attributes, the last one added to the list is kept.
The <xref:System.Collections.IList> with the attributes is created once. If there are duplicate attributes in the list, only the first instance is saved; all subsequent duplicate attributes are removed from the list.

Docs.param: The of the invocation target.
The potential invocation target.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the object that should be used during invocation of members.
Docs.returns: The object to be used during member invocations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Normally, the return value will be the same as the `instance` parameter. If another object has been associated with this instance, or if the instance is a custom type descriptor, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.GetInvocationTarget%2A> method may return a different value.
